definition: to make easy money/to make a fortune/to line one's pockets
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

horizontal/across/crosswise/horizontal stroke (in Chinese characters)/to place (sth) flat (on a surface)/to cross (a river, etc)/in a jumble/chaotic/(in fixed expressions) harsh and unreasonable/violent

sentences.english: All the while, making both foreign and Chinese traders very wealthy.
sentences.chinese: 这让外国和中国的商人大发横财。

sentences.english: The runup in business school applications during the recession has created a windfall for essay writers.
sentences.chinese: 衰退期间涌现的商学院申请令论文写手大发横财。

sentences.english: Speculators eager to earn a fast buck often wind up in bankruptcy.
sentences.chinese: 急于想发横财的投机者到头来往往破产。

sentences.english: As I was going through that period of financial scarcity, I prayed that I didn’t experience a cash windfall.
sentences.chinese: 在我身无分文的那段时间，我祈祷自己不会大发横财。

sentences.english: One day jack, a single -mined lad, decided to go forth to seek his fortune.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，纯真的杰克决定要离家去发横财。

sentences.english: Many of these knights have turned war into a profitable career by becoming mercenaries.
sentences.chinese: 许多骑士选择佣兵生涯，在战争中大发横财。

sentences.english: Corrupt officials in old China used to capitalize on naturalcalamities.
sentences.chinese: 旧中国的贪官污吏往往利用自然灾害大发横财。

sentences.english: The government is making windfall profits from everyone by selling land.
sentences.chinese: 政府正在通过卖土地来发横财。

definition: one of the twelve animals symbolic of the earthly branches 地支[di4 zhi1]/animal from the Chinese zodiac
the time comes, fortune turns (idiom); to have a lucky break/things change for the better
profits pouring in from all sides (idiom)/raking in money/bonanza
lit. ten thousand strings of cash in money belt (idiom); carrying lots of money/extremely wealthy/loaded
Mandate of Heaven/the Grand Canal, 1800 km from Beijing to Hangzhou, built starting from 486 BC/usually written 大運河|大运河[Da4 Yun4 he2]
